alert.note: Alert for Windham; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 11:04AM EDT until July 11 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Vermont... Connecticut River AT North Walpole affecting Sullivan, Windsor, Windham and Cheshire Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford and Cumberland Counties. Contoocook River At Henniker affecting Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. Sugar River At West Claremont affecting Sullivan County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Connecticut River at North Walpole. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Minor flooding affects low lying areas along the river from Walpole and Westminster downstream to the Massachusetts border. Portions of low lying roads along the river are affected including Route 5 and some adjacent businesses in Westminster. Farming interests along the river could experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 18.1 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
